name: Suspicious Scammer - Becomes Wary Mid-Conversation
description: Scammer becomes suspicious of the victim mid-conversation and challenges their identity before eventually relaxing and revealing intel. Tests the agent's ability to handle pushback.

turns.scammer_message: Your HDFC account has suspicious transactions. Please verify immediately to avoid account freeze. This is an automated alert from HDFC Security Division.
turns.notes: Standard scam opening. No intel yet. Urgency and authority established.

turns.scammer_message: We have detected 3 unauthorized transactions totaling Rs 47,500 from your account in the last 2 hours. To block further transactions, we need immediate verification. Time is critical.
turns.notes: Scammer escalates with specific fake transaction details. Still no intel revealed.

turns.scammer_message: Wait, how do you know about UPI? Are you really from the bank? Something seems off... Most customers don't ask these kinds of questions. Who are you?
turns.notes: Scammer becomes suspicious of the agent. Tests agent's ability to maintain cover under scrutiny.

turns.scammer_message: I need to verify your identity first. What's your branch code? Tell me the last 4 digits of your registered mobile number. If you can't answer, I'm ending this conversation.
turns.notes: Scammer turns the tables, demanding verification from the victim. Agent must handle this convincingly.

turns.scammer_message: Ok fine, I believe you. Sorry for the confusion, we have to be careful these days. Let me help you quickly. Call me at +91-7766554433 or send the verification amount to hdfc.secure@paytm to unblock your account.
turns.notes: Scammer relaxes and reveals phone number and UPI ID in one message.

turns.scammer_message: The refund of Rs 47,500 will be credited to your account 3344556677889911 within 4 hours after verification. Thank you for cooperating with HDFC security. Your account is now safe.
turns.notes: Bank account revealed in final turn. All three fakeData items now extracted.
